title: AU Deals: Hook Sling Into the Hottest Monster Hunter Wilds Deals, Cheap AAA Must Owns, and More!

byline: The Best Gaming Deals In Australia

text: Your hunt for bargains is over.Gamers of all genres, bargain hunters, and lovers of digital delights, gather round and get ready to save serious dough. Of particular note, right now is review D-Day for the very well-received Monster Hunter Wilds (worth a preorder). Otherwise, this week's lineup of gaming discounts looks to be packed with unmissable deals, so let's Hook Sling into the best of the bunch.This Day in Gaming ðŸŽ‚In retro news, I've spent some craaazy money on a 25-shaped birthday cake for Crazy Taxi. This Dreamcast classic was the start of a better-than-fare open-world racing trilogy that was steadily ported across from the arcades. Ludicrously fast and brimming with an uncommon level of freedom in its A to B delivering antics, this version came with all of the epic soundtrack (see: Bad Religion and The Offspring) and added many a mini-game. I lost way too many hours attempting the insanely difficult ten-pin bowling/drifting ones. Interestinglyâ€”and as if to prove that nothing changes 'cause it's all the sameâ€”it seems Sega is in the process of rebooting this fine game. html:
Your hunt for bargains is over.

Gamers of all genres, bargain hunters, and lovers of digital delights, gather round and get ready to save serious dough. Of particular note, right now is review D-Day for the very well-received Monster Hunter Wilds (worth a preorder). Otherwise, this week's lineup of gaming discounts looks to be packed with unmissable deals, so let's Hook Sling into the best of the bunch.

This Day in Gaming ðŸŽ‚

In retro news, I've spent some craaazy money on a 25-shaped birthday cake for Crazy Taxi. This Dreamcast classic was the start of a better-than-fare open-world racing trilogy that was steadily ported across from the arcades. Ludicrously fast and brimming with an uncommon level of freedom in its A to B delivering antics, this version came with all of the epic soundtrack (see: Bad Religion and The Offspring) and added many a mini-game. I lost way too many hours attempting the insanely difficult ten-pin bowling/drifting ones.

Interestinglyâ€”and as if to prove that nothing changes 'cause it's all the sameâ€”it seems Sega is in the process of rebooting this fine game. I guess it all just happens again, way down the line.

Aussie bdays for notable games

- Nox (PC) 2000. Get

- Crazy Taxi (DC) 2000. eBay

- Mario Power Tennis (GC) 2005. Sequel

- Heavy Rain (PS3) 2010. Redux

- Echoshift (PSP) 2010. eBay

- Killzone 3 (PS3) 2011. eBay

- Bit.Trip Flux (Wii) 2011. eBay

- Resi Evil Revelations 2 (PS3/4) 2015. Get

Nice Savings for Nintendo Switch

Fire Emblem Warriors: Three Hopes

Three Hopes includes pleasant surprises. Unlike the original Fire Emblem Warriors, Three Hopes no longer feels like a musou game with references to another series layered on, but a true hybrid of Fire Emblemâ€™s social gameplay and Warriorsâ€™ battles. 8/10.
